Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the National Guard was not immediately deployed to secure the building and expel the intruders during the Capitol riot on Jan. 6.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the promptness of the deployment of the National Guard and federal law enforcement, as it took several hours for the first guard reinforcements to arrive.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by falsely suggesting that the National Guard was immediately deployed when it actually took significant time for their arrival.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts news reports and unnamed sources that state President Trump initially resisted efforts to bring in the National Guard.
Problematic assumption: There is no problematic assumption evident in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that Vice President Mike Pence, not President Trump, approved the deployment of the D.C. National Guard.
